private_information: You curate the formal action model from the textual description without emitting PDDL.
Keep predicate and action names exactly as provided: hand, cats, sneeze, spring, stupendous, texture, next, vase, collect; paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted.
Use parameters ?o0, ?o1, ?o2, ?o3 consistently across all actions.
domain_curator.goal: Produce a precise JSON schema of the domain (predicates and actions with parameters, preconditions, add and delete effects) that the orchestrator will translate into PDDL.

private_information: Initial facts: cats object_0; collect object_5 object_1; collect object_6 object_1; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_2; hand object_10; hand object_11; hand object_12; hand object_9; next object_0 object_5; next object_10 object_7; next object_11 object_8; next object_12 object_5; next object_3 object_6; next object_4 object_8; next object_9 object_8; sneeze object_3; sneeze object_4; spring object_5; spring object_7; stupendous object_1; stupendous object_2; texture object_5; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8.
Goal facts: next object_10 object_8; next object_11 object_6; next object_12 object_8; next object_9 object_5.
Candidate plan steps follow, in order:
analyst_A.goal: Summarize Scenario A as a problem instance with objects, initial facts, goal facts, and the provided candidate plan without emitting PDDL.

private_information: Initial facts: cats object_0; cats object_1; collect object_6 object_2; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_3; collect object_9 object_3; hand object_10; hand object_11; hand object_12; hand object_13; next object_0 object_6; next object_1 object_6; next object_10 object_9; next object_11 object_8; next object_12 object_9; next object_13 object_6; next object_4 object_7; next object_5 object_9; sneeze object_4; sneeze object_5; spring object_6; spring object_8; stupendous object_2; stupendous object_3; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8; texture object_9.
Goal facts: next object_10 object_6; next object_11 object_9; next object_12 object_7; next object_13 object_9.
No plan is provided for this scenario.
analyst_B.goal: Summarize Scenario B as a problem instance with objects, initial facts, and goal facts without emitting PDDL.

private_information: You will integrate the domain schema and the two scenario descriptions.
You must output the final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for Scenario B, compatible with the Fast Downward solver.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a PDDL domain modelling the six actions exactly as specified and a PDDL problem for Scenario B using the provided objects and facts; ensure Fast Downward compatibility.

public_information: This environment models a symbolic planning task over objects object_0 through object_13 with predicates: hand(x), cats(x), sneeze(x), spring(x), stupendous(x), texture(x), next(x,y), vase(x,y), collect(x,y).
Action paltry(?o0, ?o1, ?o2): preconditions {hand ?o0, cats ?o1, texture ?o2, vase ?o0 ?o1, next ?o1 ?o2}; add effects {next ?o0 ?o2}; delete effects {vase ?o0 ?o1}.
Action sip(?o0, ?o1, ?o2): preconditions {hand ?o0, cats ?o1, texture ?o2, next ?o0 ?o2, next ?o1 ?o2}; add effects {vase ?o0 ?o1}; delete effects {next ?o0 ?o2}.
Action clip(?o0, ?o1, ?o2): preconditions {hand ?o0, sneeze ?o1, texture ?o2, next ?o1 ?o2, next ?o0 ?o2}; add effects {vase ?o0 ?o1}; delete effects {next ?o0 ?o2}.

Action wretched(?o0, ?o1, ?o2, ?o3): preconditions {sneeze ?o0, texture ?o1, texture ?o2, stupendous ?o3, next ?o0 ?o1, collect ?o1 ?o3, collect ?o2 ?o3}; add effects {next ?o0 ?o2}; delete effects {next ?o0 ?o1}.
Action memory(?o0, ?o1, ?o2): preconditions {cats ?o0, spring ?o1, spring ?o2, next ?o0 ?o1}; add effects {next ?o0 ?o2}; delete effects {next ?o0 ?o1}.
Action tightfisted(?o0, ?o1, ?o2): preconditions {hand ?o0, sneeze ?o1, texture ?o2, next ?o1 ?o2, vase ?o0 ?o1}; add effects {next ?o0 ?o2}; delete effects {vase ?o0 ?o1}.
Scenario A details are provided privately to analyst_A, and Scenario B details are provided privately to analyst_B.
The orchestrator will target the Fast Downward solver; the final PDDL must include a valid :requirements section and standard STRIPS/ADL constructs.

spec.system_prompt: You are a symbolic-planning domain curator. Extract a precise domain schema from the provided public information without emitting PDDL. Return a single JSON object with keys: predicates (array of predicate symbols with arity), actions (array of objects each with name, parameters as a list like [?o0, ?o1, ...], preconditions as a list of literals like predicate arguments, add_effects, del_effects). Do not invent or rename predicates or actions. Keep parameter names exactly as ?o0, ?o1, ?o2, ?o3 where applicable.
spec.prompt: Your name is domain_curator. Use the environment public information: {environment->public_information}. Produce the domain schema JSON exactly reflecting the six actions and the nine predicates. Do not output PDDL; output only the JSON schema.

instance.system_prompt: You are a planning instance analyst. Summarize Scenario A as a JSON object with keys: name (string), objects (array), init (array of ground atoms as strings), goal (array of ground atoms as strings), optional_plan (array of grounded action strings in sequence). Do not emit PDDL.
instance.prompt: Your name is analyst_A. Use the environment public information: {environment->public_information} and your private information: {agents->analyst_A->private_information}. Return the Scenario A instance JSON; do not emit PDDL.

instance.system_prompt: You are a planning instance analyst. Summarize Scenario B as a JSON object with keys: name (string), objects (array), init (array of ground atoms as strings), goal (array of ground atoms as strings). Do not emit PDDL.
instance.prompt: Your name is analyst_B. Use the environment public information: {environment->public_information} and your private information: {agents->analyst_B->private_information}. Return the Scenario B instance JSON; do not emit PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert PDDL engineer targeting the Fast Downward solver. Integrate the provided domain schema and instances to produce the final PDDL. Output exactly one PDDL domain and one PDDL problem for Scenario B. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags. The domain must declare :requirements appropriate for STRIPS with equality only if used, avoid derived predicates and negative preconditions, use only the specified predicates and the six actions with parameters and effects exactly as specified, and ensure action parameter ordering aligns with the schema. The problem must include all relevant objects (object_0 through object_13), an :init with all given ground atoms for Scenario B, and a :goal conjunction with all Scenario B goal facts. Use consistent naming: domain obfuscated-deceptive-logistics-16 and problem instance-b.
pddl.prompt: You will receive a domain schema from domain_curator and two scenario summaries from analyst_A and analyst_B: {domain_schema} {problem_A_data} {problem_B_data}. Produce the final PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem for Scenario B, enclosed in <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags. Ensure compatibility with Fast Downward and that the domain exactly models the six actions as specified. If there is any discrepancy between sources, prefer the action definitions in the domain schema and the facts in problem_B_data.
